bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Pages H4213-H4214]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. TITUS:H.R. 2626.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 1; The Congress shall havePower to lay and collect Taxes, Duties, Imposts and Excises,to pay the Debts and provide for the common Defence andgeneral Welfare of the United States; but[[Page H4214]]all Duties, Imposts and Excises shall be uniform throughoutthe United States.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Manufacturing, and Trade.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

summary.text: Amends the Travel Promotion Act of 2009 to extend permanently the funding for the Corporation for Travel Promotion. (Under current law, such funding terminates at the end of FY2015.)

bill.title: To extend funding for the Corporation for Travel Promotion under the Travel Promotion Act of 2009.

To extend funding for the Corporation for Travel Promotion under the Travel Promotion Act of 2009.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
